name: Route
description: Creates a new route in a route table within a VPC. The route's target can be either a gateway attached to the VPC or a NAT instance in the VPC.

properties.name: DestinationCidrBlock
properties.description: The CIDR address block used for the destination match. For example, 0.0.0.0/0. Routing decisions are based on the most specific match.

properties.name: GatewayId
properties.description: The ID of an Internet gateway or virtual private gateway that is attached to your VPC. For example: igw-eaad4883.

properties.name: InstanceId
properties.description: The ID of a NAT instance in your VPC. For example, i-1a2b3c4d.

properties.name: NatGatewayId
properties.description: The ID of a NAT gateway. For example, nat-0a12bc456789de0fg.

properties.name: NetworkInterfaceId
properties.description: Allows the routing of network interface IDs.

properties.name: RouteTableId
properties.description: The ID of the route table where the route will be added.
